alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Vance, western Warren and northeastern Franklin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Louisburg, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Norlina, Middleburg, Centerville, Satterwhite Point Marina, Drewry, Afton, Steele Creek Marina & Campground, Bullocksville and Kerr Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
